remarks: If the difference of two functions is eventually bounded, eventual boundedness of either one implies the other.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 26-May-2016.)
statement:
o1dif.1 $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. A ) -> B e. CC ) $.
o1dif.2 $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. A ) -> C e. CC ) $.
o1dif.3 $e |- ( ph -> ( x e. A |-> ( B - C ) ) e. O(1) ) $.
o1dif $p |- ( ph -> ( ( x e. A |-> B ) e. O(1) <-> ( x e. A |-> C ) e. O(1) ) ) $.
$d A x $.
$d ph x $.
